outputs.output_descr: The aim of the project is to support the Iraqi oversight organizations who are seeking greater capacity and cooperation to implement the United Nations Convention against Corruption, and strengthen its capability to enforce international law as part of its efforts to fight corruption and related financial crimes. In particular, Iraq oversight organizations have expressed the desire to improve their ability to detect, trace and recover stolen assets and to pursue extradition of suspects from foreign jurisdictions. This project proposes to develop these capacities, engage and collaborate with national and international actors in asset recovery and extradition of suspects when necessary. The project is to improve Iraq's participation in regional and international networks and forums on anti-corruption issues, In addition, the project will strengthen the capacity of Iraq's Anti-Corruption Academy to provide sustained, quality training services to all national actors and thereby contribute to improving transparency and accountability within the anti-corruption institutions.

project_descr: The Iraqi oversight organizations are seeking greater capacity and cooperation to implement the United Nations Convention against Corruption
